_A_CLOAK_COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION_: The ACloak component displays a loading indicator with text indicating the current loading of the page or a large component. It supports various customization options, including text alignment, size of the indicator, and the ability to change the HTML tag for rendering.
_A_CLOAK_GROUP_ALIGN_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use align. It allows you to adjust the alignment of the text and spinner to the center, left, or right. For example, the first spinner is aligned to the left, the second to the center, and the third to the right.
_A_CLOAK_GROUP_SIZES_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use size to control the sizes of both the text and loading indicator. Values range from 1 (largest) to 7 (smallest).
_A_CLOAK_GROUP_TEXT_ALIGN_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use text-align. This property allows you to align the text accompanying the loading spinner to the left or right. In the first example, the text is aligned to the left, while in the second it is aligned to the right.
_A_CLOAK_GROUP_TEXT_DESCRIPTION_: This example shows how to use text and extra. The extra parameter allows you to dynamically change the text. In this case, the text displays the message 'Loading 1', where the number {{ number }} is taken from the passed extra object.
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_ALIGN_DESCRIPTION_: Defines the alignment of the text and spinner within the component. Possible values: left, center, and right.
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_SIZE_DESCRIPTION_: Defines the size of the text and loading indicator. Valid values range from 1 (largest) to 7 (smallest).
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_SPINNER_CLASS_DESCRIPTION: CSS class for customizing the appearance of the loading indicator.
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_TAG_DESCRIPTION_: HTML tag used to render the component.
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_TEXT_ALIGN_DESCRIPTION_: Defines the alignment of the text relative to the spinner. Possible values: left and right. By default, the text is right-aligned.
_A_CLOAK_PROPS_TEXT_DESCRIPTION_: Text that will be displayed next to the loading indicator.
